abstract: How oil executives and sports gamblers make different versions of a similar mistake.
snippet: How oil executives and sports gamblers make different versions of a similar mistake.
lead_paragraph: I have an essay in this weekend’s Times Magazine about one of the lessons of the BP oil spill: the difficulty that people have estimating the odds of low-probability, high-cost events.

headline.main: The BP Spill and the Favorite-Longshot Bias
